question.title: Getting <Response><Message> tags in Whatsapp messages Twilio WhatsApp Flow
question.body:
I am using Twilio Sandbox to experiment with setting up a Whatsapp flow. I was able to setup the flow successfully with a Springboot / Java backend and configuring a webhook for Twilio to call into to run the entire flow.

While it works smoothly, I see that if I don't add the opening tags <Response><Message> and closing tags </Response></Message> to my response messages Twilio doesn't seem to honor the message at all.

The webhook is a POST type method and returns String. The String I return is essentially this <Response><Message> + response + </Response></Message> Where response is the variable that contains the response text.

When I receive the response on my WhatsApp application, I see the XML tags also are part of the entire text. If I remove the tags, Twilio stops responding.

How do I send a message without the tags appearing on my WhatsApp application?

question_comments.body: Can you please share a minimal example to reproduce this? Also, make sure you set the right content-type
